Summary Renita's focus is to assist companies within the technology sector to streamline operations, understand their global market share and assist with lead generation. Prior to working for SourceDNA, Inc., she was Chief of Staff for public figures. She was an executive administrator to Paul Kocher, who gained international recognition for his research and innovative designs in security and cryptography and to Dr. Linda Darling-Hammond, who participated in President Barack Obama's education policy group. She worked behind the scenes managing a variety of social policy issues, supporting various education projects such as School Redesign Network, Teachers for a New Era and Stanford New Schools' East Palo Alto Academy (K-12), and orchestrating the schedule and interactions of highly visible Stanford University faculty members. She has been an active contributor organizing major conferences and public initiatives. In addition, she developed her expertise while serving as Business Affairs Advisor to Secretary of State (U.S. Senator) John F. Kerry. In this role, she was responsible for an array of constituent issues, event coordination, and campaign advancement work for the 2004 presidential campaign and received a commendation from the White House. Experience Sales Development Manager SourceDNA January 2015  – Present (8 months) Piedmont/Oakland Renita's expertise stems from her strong research, communication and analytical skills. She utilizes her interpersonal and public relation experience (within the government, technical and business sectors) to synthesize legal, political and business data for presentation and review. She is successful in organizing and planning complex events and liaises effectively within non-profit and administrative operations and public relations environments. Who's Who Honors & Awards Leading Professional Cambridge Who's Who June 2009 SAN FRANCISCO, CA, June 10, 2009 /24-7PressRelease/ -- Renita N. Attardi,has been recognized by Cambridge Who's Who for exhibiting dedication, leadership and excellence in all aspects of business management. 
 
As Human Resources and Operations Manager at Cryptography Research, Inc., Renita is responsible for managing office operations, coordinating press briefings, organizing trade shows/technical conferences, providing executive support to the President/Chief Research Scientist and hiring engineering staff. 
 
Prior to joining Cryptography Research, Renita managed public figures. As Executive Administrator to Dr. Linda Darling-Hammond, who participated in President Barack Obama's education policy group, Renita worked behind the scenes handling a variety of social policy issues, supporting various education projects (e.g. School Redesign Network [SRN], Teachers for a New Era [TNE] and Stanford New Schools [SNS] East Palo Alto Academy K-12), and orchestrating the schedule and interactions of highly visible Stanford University faculty members. Renita developed her expertise while serving as Business Affairs Advisor to Senator John F. Kerry prior to his official White House run in 2004. In this role, she held responsibility for an array of constituent issues, event coordination, and campaign advance work for the 2004 presidential campaign. 
 
Renita earned a B.A., summa cum laude, in Political Science/Public Policy Studies from Pine Manor College. She is a member of Alpha Chi Scholarship Society and Phi Theta Kappa. Additionally, Renita earned an A.S., summa cum laude, in Interior Architectural Design from Newbury College. She achieved numerous design awards for technical and academic excellence. 
 
 Additional Honors & Awards Obtained federal government security clearance and Commendation from the White House Leading Professional Cambridge Who's Who June 2009 SAN FRANCISCO, CA, June 10, 2009 /24-7PressRelease/ -- Renita N.
